2. modules¶

2.1. clamm¶

clamm is a module containing command line interface implementation and utilities.

clamm.config_edit(args)¶

Open config.json in $EDITOR.

clamm.config_show(args)¶

Dump config.json to STDOUT

clamm.create_config_parsers(subps)¶

creates config sub-parsers

clamm.create_database_parsers(subps)¶

creates tag database sub-parsers

clamm.create_library_parsers(subps)¶

creates library sub-parsers

clamm.create_stream_parsers(subps)¶

creates streams subparsers

clamm.library_action(args)¶

calls walker() with args provided at command line.

Example

$ clamm library action --recently_added
clamm.library_initialize(args)¶

calls initialize() with args provided at command line.

Example

$ clamm library initialize
clamm.library_playlist(args)¶

calls playlist() with args provided at command line.

Example

$ clamm library playlist
clamm.library_synchronize(args)¶

calls synchronize() with args provided at command line.

Example

$ clamm library synchronize
clamm.main()¶

clamm entrance point.

Parses and executes the action specified by the command line inputs.

clamm.parse_inputs()¶

populate a heirarchical argument parser

clamm.printr(func_or_msg, verbosic_precedence=3, caller=True)¶

a utility that enables callers simplify printing behavior.

Parameters:
  • func_or_msg – Either a function handle to call or a message string
  • print. (to) –
Kwargs:
verbosic_precedence: Integer setting verbosity level. If not set, the message is printed if the config value verbosity is higher than the default value. The caller can short-circuit the config value by setting the kwarg. caller: Bool indicating whether or not to print the caller name.
clamm.streams_listing(args)¶

Calls listing2streams() with listing provided at command line.

$ clamm library initialize
clamm.streams_stream(args)¶

Calls main()

clamm.streams_tracks(args)¶

Calls stream2tracks() with streampath provided at command line.

$ clamm streams initialize
clamm.tags_edit(args)¶

Open tag database in $EDITOR

clamm.tags_show(args)¶

Dump tags database to STDOUT

2.2. audiolib¶

an interface to a classical music audio library.

class audiolib.AudioLib(args)¶

external interface to audiolib module

initialize()¶

initialize a new music library of audiofiles

synchronize()¶

synchronize the audiofile’s composer/artist/arrangement tags with the tag database

walker(func, **kwargs)¶

Recursively walks the directories/sub-directories under root and applies specified function to each audio file encountered.

Parameters:func – action to apply to audio files.
audiolib.commit_to_libfile(tagfile)¶

common entry point for writing values from tag database into an audiofile.

audiolib.is_audio_file(name)¶

readability short-cut for testing whether file contains a known audio file extension as defined in config["file"]["known_types"]

audiolib.pcm2wav(pcm_name, wav_name)¶

utility for calling ffmpeg to convert a pcm file to a wav file

audiolib.wav2flac(wav_name)¶

utility for using ffmpeg to convert a wav file to a flac file

2.3. tags¶

the tags module contains classes and functions that create an interface to the clamm’s tag database.

class tags.SafeTagFile(filepath)¶

Allow for consistent file tagging.

Subclasses taglib.File and creates a deep copy of a taglib.File objects

Parameters:filepath (str) – the absolute file path to the audio file.
tag_copy¶

taglib.File – a copy that allows for before/after comparison.

class tags.Suggestor(tagdb, category='artist')¶

Auto-suggestion support

Implements prompt_toolkit.auto_suggest.AutoSuggestFromHistory by populating history with a list of items from one of the tag database sets.

Parameters:
  • tagdb (tags.TagDatabase) – provides access to the sets in tags.json.
  • category (str, optional) – Inidicate which set categorytegory to populate the history with, one of {artist, composer, instrument, nationality, period}. Default is artist.
class tags.TagDatabase¶

Primary object for interaction with the library tag database.

Manages tags.json, including adding new artists/composers.

path¶

str – path to tags.json file, set via config["path"]["database"]

arange¶

Arrangement – Arrangement instance used for verifying track instrumental arrangement.

new_item¶

dict – container for new item to be added to database. _item_ can be one of {artist, composer, arrangement}

add_new_item(category='artist')¶

inserts a new item into the tag db after prompting for approval

add_new_perm(key, perm, category='artist')¶

add a new name permutation to the item’s permutation list

dump()¶
get_field(summary, category='nationality')¶

attempt to guess the tag value by matching the category sets against the summary words and fall back on manual entry with auto_suggest

get_new_item(item, category='artist')¶

resolves fields for a new item by attempting auto-population via item_fields_from_wiki, and falls back on item_fields_from_manual. returns the database key of the new item

get_sorted_arrangement(tagfile, artist_set=None)¶

return an ordered dictionary of artist/instrument pairs sorted by (pre-computed) artist relative frequency in library

item_fields_from_manual(item, category='artist')¶

alternative to item_fields_from_wiki in case wiki_query is not successful.

fetches new item fields manually with help from auto-suggestion

item_fields_from_wiki(item, page, category='artist')¶

auto-populate database tags a successful wikipedia query

update_sets()¶

update the tag sets by scanning the database and compiling artist, nationality, composer, instrument, and period

verify_arrangement(artist_set, tagfile, skipflag=False)¶

Arrangements are used to synchronize artist entries in the database with files in the library.

verify_artist(query_name)¶

verify that the artist query name (qname) has an entry in the tag database if it doesn’t, propose a series of steps to remedy.

verify_composer(qname)¶

returns the tag database key given the query name found in the tage file by verifying the query name has a match in the tag database. If it doesn’t, initiates add_new_item and then, circuitously, returns the key

tags.get_borndied(summary)¶

gets borndied/died dates

Use a regexp to extract artist/composer date(s) from a wikipedia summary string.

Parameters:summary (str) – the summary corresponding to a wikipedia query.
Returns:borndied – Dates of subject birth and death. Example format is 1910-1990.
Return type:str
tags.get_nearest_name(qname, name_set)¶

return closest match by finding minimum edit_distance

Parameters:
  • qname (str) – query name against which seeking match
  • name_set (set) – set of names of which qname is possible member
Returns:
Return type:

the element from name_set which minimizes distance to qname.
tags.get_translation(search)¶

Translate non-Latin characters

occasionally artist name will be in non-Latin characters. Prompts the user to supply the From language.

Parameters:search (str) – the search string
Returns:
Return type:search string translated to Latin characters.
tags.messylist2set(alist)¶

owing to laziness, these lists may contain gotchas

tags.swap_first_last_name(name_str)¶

if name_str contains a comma (assume it is formatted as Last, First), invert and return First Last else, invert and return Last, First

tags.wiki_query(search)¶

Perform a Wikipedia search

Fetches a result from wikipedia and prompts user to select correct page, if one exists.

Parameters:search (str) – The query
Returns:
  • if query is successful, returns a wikipedia.page object
  • otherwise, returns None

2.4. streams¶

streams module contains classes, programs, tools for creating and processing audio streams.

class streams.Album(stream)¶

Given a stream object, locate the tracks within the stream, create new flac tracks, and populate with metadata.

create()¶

find track starts/stops within stream

find_end_frame(reference)¶

find the min energy point around a reference

find_start_frame()¶

find audio signal activity that exceeds threshold and persists call this the start frame of a track

process()¶

encapsulate the substance of Album processing

streams.dial_itunes(artist, album)¶

run apple script and attempt to uniquely locate the artist/album pair.

streams.image_audio_envelope_with_tracks_markers(markers, stream)¶

track-splitting validation image

streams.is_started(filepath)¶

test to see if recording has started

streams.listing2streams(listing)¶

a program for batch streaming a json listing of albums from iTunes to raw pcm files via shairport-sync.

iTunes is controlled using macos’ built-in osascript tool and simple javascript request templates.

When the listings have finished streaming, the pcm files (streams) can be processed by stream2tracks and converted from streams to a collection of flac tracks.

streams.main(args)¶

main is a concatenation of listing2streams and stream2tracks

streams.power_envelope(wavpath)¶
streams.read_wav_mono(wav, N)¶

grab samples from one channel (every other sample) of frame

streams.size_sampler(filepath)¶

return the file size, sampled with a 1 second gap to determine if the file is being written to.

streams.start_shairport(filepath)¶

make sure no duplicate processes and start up shairport-sync

streams.stream2tracks(streampath)¶

process raw pcm stream to tagged album tracks.
